name: ICNA Council for Social Justice
mission: To systematically facilitate assertive Muslim involvement in the field of human struggle for the rights of the poor and oppressed.
theoryOfChange: Shifting the narrative from solely providing aid to demanding systemic change through policy advocacy, anti-criminalization efforts, and supportive programming.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://icnacsj.org/zakat (Source: https://icnacsj.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: UNKNOWN (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Icna Council for Social Justice shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://icnacsj.org/zakat (Source: https://icnacsj.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a Charity Navigator score of 86.5/100 and focuses on social justice programs.
The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
The charity reported total revenue of $834,440, a program expense ratio of 82.6%, and 7.3 months of working capital.
The charity provides multiple donation options including zakat and general contributions.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid 70/100 score due to its high financial efficiency and strong alignment with Muslim donor values through its zakat-eligible programs.
areas_for_improvement: Enhance data transparency to improve overall data confidence scores
Expand third-party impact verification for specific program outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high due to the organization's religious and cultural urgency, serving as a primary vehicle for Muslim social justice advocacy [2]. The charity's zakat-eligible status and focus on the oppressed resonate strongly with Islamic philanthropic principles [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates direct impact through its criminal justice and immigration programs, backed by a Charity Navigator score of 86.5/100 [1]. With a total revenue of $834,440 and a program expense ratio of 82.6%, the charity prioritizes direct provision of services over administrative overhead [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The ICNA Council for Social Justice empowers the Muslim community to advocate for the rights of the poor and oppressed through systematic social and legal reform.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 82.6%, ensuring the majority of funds directly support advocacy and services
Strong fundraising efficiency with only $0.09 spent to raise every $1
Maintains a healthy liquidity position with 7.3 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The ICNA Council for Social Justice is a non-profit organization dedicated to assertive Muslim involvement in human rights advocacy, specifically focusing on criminal justice and immigration reform [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting social justice initiatives [2][4].

all_citations.quote: To systematically facilitate assertive Muslim involvement in the field of human struggle for the rights of the poor and oppressed.
Our programs include Criminal Justice, Immigration, Hunger, Homelessness, and Islamophobia.
ICNA CSJ is a Zakat-eligible organization.

all_citations.claim: overall score of 86.86.5/100 from Charity Navigator

all_citations.claim: lack of publicly available beneficiary counts
all_citations.quote: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring

all_citations.claim: documenting a clear theory of change

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid 70/100 score due to its high financial efficiency and strong alignment with Muslim donor values through its zakat-eligible programs.

areas_for_improvement.context: While program spending is high, the charity currently lacks <cite id="14">publicly available beneficiary counts</cite>, making it difficult to calculate cost-per-beneficiary metrics.
The organization’s evidence base is currently classified as 'developing,' as it lacks <cite id="15">external evaluations or multi-year outcome tracking</cite>.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization does not currently have a completed BBB Wise Giving Alliance review.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is in a growth phase, with revenue increasing by over 20% annually, providing more resources for future evaluation.
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="14">lack of standardized impact reporting</cite> and external verification of program success.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data current through 2023 tax year
confidence.notes: Strong financial transparency but limited impact measurement data.

alignment.explanation: The charity offers <cite id="6">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serves the 'fuqara' (poor) asnaf category through its <cite id="2">hunger and homelessness programs</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the organization due to its <cite id="11">100% independent board</cite> and a <cite id="16">perfect 100 score for Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should work toward <cite id="17">meeting all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards</cite>, as it currently lacks a completed review.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="5">82.6% program expense ratio</cite> and a direct service delivery model that addresses <cite id="12">immigration and criminal justice</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="18">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> with explicit causal pathways for its advocacy work.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Developing Theory of Change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct program implementation rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The ICNA Council for Social Justice empowers the Muslim community to advocate for the rights of the poor and oppressed through systematic social and legal reform.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support domestic social justice and civil rights advocacy within an Islamic framework while ensuring their zakat is used for systemic reform.
donor_motivations: Want to address Islamophobia and criminal justice reform in the US
Prefer lean organizations where nearly 100% of funds reach programs
Seek to fulfill zakat through advocacy for the oppressed
Value high revenue growth and organizational momentum
giving_considerations: Donations support advocacy which has long-term, non-linear impact
Limited quantitative data on the exact number of individuals served
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international humanitarian relief or those who require rigorous, third-party randomized controlled trials (RCTs) to justify their giving.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while the charity reports on its activities, it has not yet published <cite id="15">independent evaluations or rigorous outcome metrics</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CSJ creates impact by mobilizing the Muslim community to advocate for legislative changes and providing direct services to those affected by systemic poverty and legal injustice.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that advocacy efforts are effectively changing lives and that resources are not just spent, but are achieving justice.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="19">$834,440 revenue base</cite> and a growing advocacy mandate, the organization has significant capacity to scale its domestic chapters.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an exceptionally high <cite id="5">82.6% program ratio</cite> compared to larger advocacy peers.

similar_organizations.differentiator: More focus on direct social services vs advocacy
similar_organizations.name: ICNA Relief

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="5">82.6% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding industry benchmarks for advocacy groups.
CSJ maintains <cite id="7">7.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a stable buffer for long-term advocacy campaigns.
The charity spends only <cite id="8">$0.09 to raise every $1</cite>, demonstrating highly lean development operations.

strengths_deep_dive: The ICNA Council for Social Justice demonstrates a robust commitment to financial accountability, evidenced by an <cite id="9">overall score of 86.86.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. Its governance structure is notably transparent, featuring an <cite id="10">independent board of 8 members</cite> with <cite id="11">100% independent membership</cite>. This oversight supports a diverse range of domestic programs, from <cite id="12">Islamophobia monitoring to homelessness support</cite>, all while maintaining a lean executive structure where the <cite id="13">CEO receives $31,090 in compensation</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The ICNA Council for Social Justice (CSJ) serves as a dedicated advocacy and social service arm for the American Muslim community, focusing on the rights of the marginalized. The organization operates with a mission to <cite id="1">systematically facilitate assertive Muslim involvement</cite> in human rights struggles, specifically targeting <cite id="2">criminal justice, immigration, and hunger</cite>. Financially, the organization has shown significant growth, reporting <cite id="3">$834,440 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 22.7%</cite>. This growth is paired with high operational efficiency, as the charity maintains a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 82.6%</cite> according to its latest filings, ensuring that nearly all contributions are directed toward its core advocacy and service missions. The organization is also <cite id="6">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, providing a structured pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through social justice work in the United States.
